BusinessName.BusinessNameLine2Txt: C/O LUTHERAN SOCIAL SERVICES OF ILLINOIS

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: HUD SUBSIDIZED HOUSING FOR THE ELDERLY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: SALEM VILLAGE III, INC. IS A SERVICE CORPORATION ORGANIZED FOR THE PURPOSE OF PROVIDING ELDERLY INDIVIDUALS WITH HOUSING FACILITIES AND SERVICES DESIGNED TO MEET THEIR SPECIAL NEEDS AND TO PROMOTE HEALTH, SECURITY, HAPPINESS, AND USEFULNESS.
IRS990.Desc: PROVIDED HOUSING FOR THE ELDERLY, IN A FACILITY WITH 242 UNITS.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART III, LINE 12, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL OFFICERS ARE EMPLOYEES OF LUTHERAN SOCIAL SERVICES OF ILLINOIS (LSSI), A RELATED ORGANIZATION. LSSI USES THE FOLLOWING METHODS TO ESTABLISH THE COMPENSATION OF THE CEO: COMPENSATION COMMITTEE; WRITTEN EMPLOYMENT CONTRACT; AND APPROVAL BY THE BOARD OR COMPENSATION COMMITTEE.
MARK STUTRUD, CEO OF LSSI, IS ENTITLED TO BENEFITS UNDER A 457F PLAN MAINTAINED BY LSSI. DURING FY23, THE AMOUNT ACCRUED WAS $44,979 AND MARK RECEIVED A PAYOUT OF $400,000.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AN ELECTRONIC COPY OF FORM 990 IS SENT TO BOTH THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND TO THE AUDIT COMMITTEE OF LUTHERAN SOCIAL SERVICES OF ILLINOIS (LSSI), A RELATED ORGANIZATION, FOR THEIR REVIEW. ANY CHANGES OR COMMENTS RESULTING FROM THEIR REVIEW ARE THEN REFLECTED IN THE FORM 990 PRIOR TO ITS FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE POSSIBLE CONFLICTS OF INTEREST ANNUALLY BY SIGNING THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. ADDITIONALLY, THE ORGANIZATION USES A GROUP PURCHASING ORGANIZATION THAT MONITORS POSSIBLE CONFLICTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

THE AUDIT COMMITTEE OF LSSI IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT AS WELL AS THE SELECTION AND RECOMMENDATION OF THE INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT TO THE BOARD FOR ITS APPROVAL ON BEHALF OF THE ORGANIZATION.

U.S. DEPARTMENT OF HOUSING AND URBAN DEVELOPMENT, ASSISTED LIVING CONVERSION GRANT, NOT TO EXCEED $6,339,159, NO PRINCIPAL PAYMENTS REQUIRED, NON-INTEREST BEARING, DUE JULY 1, 2039, SECURED BY BUILDING. IF THE PROJECT IS IS USED FOR APPROVED PURPOSES OVER THE TERM, THE LOAN WILL BE DEEMED TO BE PAID AND DISCHARGED. THE AMOUNT DRAWN TO DATE IS $6,339,159. GRANT REVENUE OF $5,824,919 FROM THIS AGREEMENT WAS BEING RECOGNIZED OVER THE TERM OF THE AGREEMENT ON A STRAIGHT-LINE BASIS, THROUGH JUNE 30, 2019. EFFECTIVE JULY 1, 2019 THE PROJECT ADOPTED ASU NO. 2018-08 AND AS REQUIRED BY THE STANDARD, THE PROJECT IS NO LONGER RECOGNIZING REVENUE OVER THE TERM OF THE AGREEMENT AND WILL RECOGNIZE THE REMAINING REVENUE AT THE TIME ALL CONDITIONS ARE MET BY THE PROJECT. THE CONDITIONAL ASSISTED LIVING CONVERSION GRANT RECORDED AT JUNE 30, 2023 AND 2022 WAS $3,602,995.
